inlineContent.text: KeyboardKit helps you create custom keyboards for iOS and iPadOS, using Swift and SwiftUI. It extends Apple’s native keyboard APIs and provides you with more functionality.
KeyboardKit lets you create keyboards that mimic native iOS keyboards in a few lines of code.
KeyboardKit can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
, although some features are unavailable on some platforms.
KeyboardKit is available under the MIT license.

This class can be used to observe the state of any keyboard.

specific state, including configurations and suggestions.
This enum contains audio feedback types that maps to system

This namespace contains styling-related types.
This enum can be used to specify an interface orientation.
This protocol can be implemented by services that are bound

This namespace contains dictation-related types, as well as

This keyboard can be used to create alphabetic, numeric and
symbolic keyboards that mimic the native iOS keyboard.
This protocol is used to make using the keyboard input view
controller more abstract and available to more platforms.
A keyboard layout defines the keys and spaces on a keyboard,
often including keys around the input rows and a bottom row.
This article describes the KeyboardKit device utilities.
This article describes the KeyboardKit state engine.
